meanings.definition: To give a particular texture or surface to something.
meanings.sent1: She used a special brush to texturize the paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer decided to texturize the walls with a unique wallpaper.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to texturize the soup by adding crunchy croutons on top.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes texturize the painting, creating depth and dimension.
meanings.sent5: The hairstylist used a technique to texturize the hair, giving it a more natural look.

meanings.definition: To make something more interesting or varied by adding different elements.
meanings.sent1: The author wanted to texturize the story by introducing a new character.
meanings.sent2: The music producer decided to texturize the song with additional instruments.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to texturize his routine by adding funny sound effects.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was texturized with personal anecdotes, making it engaging and relatable.
meanings.sent5: The garden was texturized with a variety of plants, creating a visually appealing landscape.
